conversation.text: The first step is to separate the egg whites from the yolks.
evidence: Separate the egg whites from the yolks and place them into a bowl

conversation.text: Whisk water and seasonings in with the egg whites.
evidence: Whisk in the water along with a pinch of salt and a dash of pepper.

conversation.text: What do I do with the mixture now?
Set the bowl to the side and prepare for the next step.
Ok, I've done that. Do I need to grab anything else?
You will need a nonstick skillet and olive oil.
evidence: Heat the olive oil in a nonstick skillet over medium-high heat.

conversation.text: Does the size of the skillet matter?
You will need a skillet that is large enough to cook an omelette in.
Got it. So what do we do next? I've put my skillet on the stove and the olive oil is sizzling.
Once the oil is hot enough, you're going to saute the spinach and seasonings, stirring constantly, until the spinach is cooked.
evidence: Once the oil is hot, add the spinach along with some salt and pepper.

conversation.text: I don't like spinach. Can I put something else in this dish?
Absolutely! You're welcome to try thinly-sliced mushrooms, chopped onions, bell peppers, etc...
evidence: For a more hearty meal, try: sliced mushrooms, chopped onions, and diced green bell peppers.

conversation.text: That sounds delicious! My bell peppers are cooked now.
Do you want to add any other vegetables, or are you ready for cheese?
Does it matter what kind of cheese?
We recommend cottage cheese, but ricotta and Romano are also a good substitute.
evidence: you can try ricotta and/or Romano instead

conversation.text: Got it. Should I put the eggs in now, or do we do the cheese first?

recipe.title: How to Make Healthy Egg Whites for Breakfast

procedure.summary: Whisk together the egg whites, water, salt, and pepper.
procedure.description: Separate the egg whites from the yolks and place them into a bowl; save the yolks for another recipe. Whisk in the water along with a pinch of salt and a dash of pepper. Set the bowl aside.

procedure.summary: Sauté the spinach over medium-high heat.
procedure.description: Heat the olive oil in a nonstick skillet over medium-high heat. Once the oil is hot, add the spinach along with some salt and pepper. Cook the spinach, stirring constantly, until the leaves wilt and become tender. Don't like spinach? No problem! Try it with thinly-sliced mushrooms instead! For a more hearty meal, try: sliced mushrooms, chopped onions, and diced green bell peppers.

procedure.summary: Pour the egg whites into the skillet.
procedure.description: Use a spatula to spread the spinach around so that it covers the bottom of the skillet in an even layer. Pour the egg whites on top and tilt the skillet around to help them spread.

procedure.summary: Cook the omelet until the egg whites begin to set.
procedure.description: Once they start to turn white, lift up the edges of the omelet with a spatula for a few seconds. This will allow any uncooked egg white to flow underneath and cook.

procedure.summary: Sprinkle the cheese down the middle of the omelet.
procedure.description: Start with the cottage cheese, then finish off with a sprinkle of parmesan. If you don't have these two cheeses on hand, you can try ricotta and/or Romano instead. You can also omit one of the cheeses and just use one type. Mozzarella is another tasty option.
Slide a spatula under the omelet partway, then quickly flip it over like closing a book. Alternatively, you can fold both of the side edges to the middle so that they overlap, like a brochure.

procedure.summary: Slide the omelet onto a plate and serve it.
procedure.description: Do this quickly; the egg whites will continue to cook even after you remove them from the skillet. If you want to, you can garnish the omelet further with some diced tomatoes or sun dried tomatoes.
